member.name: T:Ansys.Disco.Core.Application.WindowsProcessJob
member.summary: This job object automatically adds all child processes of any added process to this job. The job determines how those processes act as managed by windows. member.name: P:Ansys.Disco.Core.Application.ICommandLineContext.UseInferno
member.summary: Activate Inferno diagnostics, even when not in Developer mode.
member.remarks: By default, diagnostics are only collected by Inferno when the application is running in . When running performance tests it can be useful to capture detailed diagnostics to a file. However, performance tests are generally run in , meaning that although a diagnostic dump will be written, all timings will be zero because Inferno is not active. By specifying the ---use-inferno command line parameter, you can force Inferno to collection diagnostic information even in .

member.name: T:Ansys.Disco.Core.Persistence.Solution.CoreData
member.summary: The root of the information persisted to /SpaceClaim/Discovery/discoverycore.xml in the .dsco file.
member.remarks: IMPORTANT: All types reachable from this class must be public, or else will raise an exception during saving or loading. In addition, all reachable types must have a public default constructor. The requirement for a default constructor prevents us from using types in the persisted object graph.

member.summary: An that writes all chunks as part of a single zip file.

member.summary: An that writes each chunk as a separate file in the specified directory.

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Persistence.Chunks.PartChunkStore.GetChunkNames
member.summary: Gets the names of all of the chunks in the .
member.returns:
A array of chunk names.
WARNING: Owing to limitations of the SpaceClaim API, folder names are lost. Thus a chunk my/folder/foo.xml will be returned as foo.xml. This is a fatal flaw because (a) you cannot distinguish between two chunks with the same name in different folders and (b) you cannot retrieve the chunk data using the name on its own because without the folder part, SpaceClaim will not find the underlying file.

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Persistence.Deferred.Add(System.Action,Ansys.Disco.Core.Issues.Localized)
member.summary: Adds a to be executed later when is called. The caller is encouraged (but not compelled) to provide a description for the action. This description will be used when reporting problems. Providing a description avoids the "anonymous delegate" problem whereby it is difficult to determine at runtime where the action has come from.
member.param: The to execute. May be , in which case will behave as though the action had never been added.
A description to use when reporting execution problems. May be if your code would prefer not to be identified as a source of failure.

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Persistence.Deferred.Add(Ansys.Disco.Core.Persistence.Deferred)
member.summary: Adds the actions from the supplied to this object. The supplied is not modified.

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Persistence.Deferred.Clear
member.summary: Removes all actions from the list without executing any of them. This method is automatically called as part of .

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Persistence.Deferred.Discharge
member.summary: Executes all of the deferred actions in the order they were added and clears the list of actions. The action list is cleared before any of the actions are executed, so it is permissible (but potentially confusing) for an action to add more actions to this class. If an individual action raises an exception, this exception will be collected as an and execution will continue with the next action in the list.
member.returns: Returns if every action executed without raising an exception. Otherwise returns an instance that captures the individual failures in .

member.summary: Executes each in turn, capturing any exception raised as an .
member.returns: Returns if successful (no action raised an exception) or an if there was a problem.

member.summary: Executes each in turn, capturing any exception raised as an .

member.name: T:Ansys.Disco.Core.Graphics.IBoundingBoxRelativeScaleConverter
member.summary:
When asked to draw a "domain relative" sized objects, different graphics engines can calculate things differently. Some may use the extents of the bounding box, whereas others can use the maximum edge length of the bounding box. They can also apply scale factors internally based on the range of inputs they expect (IE Input values are 0..100 but are treated as 0..1).
The BoundingBoxRelativeScaleConverter consumes Disco inputs to produce a value that will be consistent across multiple different domain relative scaling functions.

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Graphics.IBoundingBoxRelativeScaleConverter.Convert(System.Double,Ansys.Disco.Core.Graphics.BoundingBoxMeasurement,System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a value from an internal display measurement to the one desired by Disco.
member.param: The type of bounding box measurement internally applied.
Any constant scale factor applied internally.
member.returns: A size value which has been converted to the destination scale factor and measurement type.

member.name: T:Ansys.Disco.Core.Graphics.IGraphicsResultSizeConverter
member.summary: Providers bounding box scale converters for different modules in order to obtain consistent sizing information.

member.summary: A bounding box scale converter for streamline diameter

member.summary: A bounding box scale converter for particle size

member.name: P:Ansys.Disco.Core.Graphics.IGraphicsResultSizeConverter.VectorArrowHeadDiameter
member.summary: A bounding box scale converter for the vector arrow head diameter

member.name: P:Ansys.Disco.Core.Graphics.IGraphicsResultSizeConverter.Deformation
member.summary: A bounding box scale converter for deformation

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Hide (but not close) the diagnostics form. Does nothing if the form is already hidden or has never been created.

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Diagnostics.InfernoGui.Register(Ansys.Disco.Core.Diagnostics.InfernoWidget)
member.summary: Adds a custom tab to the Inferno window.
member.param: Defines the contents of the tab.
member.remarks:
Note:
No attempt is made to prevent duplicate registrations.
No facility is provided to unregister custom tabs.
Tabs registered after the Inferno window has been created will not be shown until the Inferno window is destroyed and recreated.

member.summary: Tracks the specified activity until is called on the returned.
member.param: Information about the call site to track.
A stack trace to record with the or if the caller doesn't want to provide a stack trace.

If , the execution time will be accumulated to the associated , but the event itself will be removed from the timeline. This is useful for tracking the application's heartbeat processing: we want to know how long it is taking (call stats) but we don't want it to overwhelm the timeline view.

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Diagnostics.Internals.Naming.NameFor(System.Object)
member.summary: Creates a name for the supplied object. The runtime type is used to make custom names for commonly-encountered types.
member.returns: A naming the object.
member.remarks: Warning: It is important that we don't explicitly reference SpaceClaim types in this class. For example, it is very tempting to create special handling for . If we do so, however, we will cause the CLR to attempt to load the SpaceClaim User Model.dll assembly. For a standard Disco build this causes no problems, but for a local SpaceClaim build this will fail if function is called before the local SpaceClaim assembly resolver event handler is registered, which will happen if Inferno is used to measure application startup time.

member.name: F:Ansys.Disco.Core.Diagnostics.Internals.Database._lock
member.summary: A lock used to serialize changes to the database.
member.remarks: This isn't a complete solution to thread-safe use of the database because readers don't acquire this lock before accessing the database and so can potentially experience inconsistency if they read data during a database update. If this becomes an issue then readers will need to start acquiring this lock before querying the database, but initially the idea is just to protect the database state from being corrupted by simultaneous logging calls coming from different threads.

member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum duration required for an activity to be recorded. Activities that take less time than the supplied value will be pruned from the tracking database.
member.value: The minimum activity duration. Specify to keep all tracked events irrespective of duration.

member.name: P:Ansys.Disco.Core.Diagnostics.Internals.Policies.MaxEventCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of events that can be stored in the database. When the number of events exceeds this threshold, the oldest 50% of the events will be discarded. There is no promise that this truncation will happen immediately, but it won't be too long before the database is updated. The purpose of this setting is place an upper limit on how large the database can grow to prevent excessive memory consumption in long-running application sessions with a low . To disable database truncation, set this value to zero or a negative integer.
member.value: The maximum number of events. No limit is imposed if this value is zero or negative.

member.name: P:Ansys.Disco.Core.Diagnostics.Internals.Policies.MaxLogCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of log entries held. Works in the same way as .
member.value: The maximum number of items. No limit is imposed if this value is zero or negative.

member.name: F:Ansys.Disco.Core.Environment.UserConfigurations.ContactDetectionSetting.Fused
member.summary: Fused
member.remarks: 20.2 method​: * One voxel grid for all parts.​ * Any defined contacts will be ignored (with appropriate messaging – yellow triangle, condition ignored message).​ * New contacts cannot be defined in Explore stage.​ NOTE - If topo opt calculation type is active, it will always use "Fused".​

members.member:
Defined
/// 20.2.5 method:​ * Separate voxel grid for each part.​ * Bodies are specifically bonded; or prevented from being connected.​ * Contacts can be defined in the explore stage.​

member.name: F:Ansys.Disco.Core.Environment.UserConfigurations.ContactDetectionSetting.Optimized
member.summary: Optimized (default)
member.remarks: * Will use FUSED contact when only bonded contacts are defined.​ * Will use DEFINED contact when contacts other than bonded are defined.​

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Events.RecordablePubSubEvent.Subscribe(System.Action,Prism.Events.ThreadOption,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Subscribes a delegate to an event.
member.param: The delegate that gets executed when the event is published.
Specifies on which thread to receive the delegate callback.
When , the keeps a reference to the subscriber so it does not get garbage collected.
member.returns: A that uniquely identifies the added subscription.
member.remarks:
If is set to , will maintain a to the Target of the supplied delegate. If not using a WeakReference ( is ), the user must explicitly call Unsubscribe for the event when disposing the subscriber in order to avoid memory leaks or unexpected behavior.
The PubSubEvent collection is thread-safe. This override exists purely for us to Mock this class and this non-virtual method.

member.summary: Enables persistence for emag chart data using an .

member.name: F:Ansys.Disco.Core.FeatureFlags.Features.MirrorballMonitors
member.summary: Enables parallel storage of ordinary (non-emag) monitor results using an .
member.remarks: WARNING: This code is not production ready for two reasons: (a) InsightsEntity uses a static global to get hold of the ResultsDatabase instead of taking a constructor dependency, and (b) the MonitorDatabase will continue to store monitor results that have been made obsolete by their parent simulation having been deleted because the MonitorDatabase is not undo-redo aware. Issue (a) is an easy fix, but to correct issue (b), a garbage collection sweep would be needed at the end of the resume process so that monitor results that were associated with non-existent DesignChangeEntity instances could be deleted from the newly-loaded Mirrorball IGraph. This sweep could be added to MonitorDatabase and executed during the resume process that is triggered from ResultsDatabase. Fortunately, at the time the chunk is resumed, the entities have already been loaded from document.xml and so reliable garbage collection of results should be possible.

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Issues.InterpolateExtension.Interpolate(System.String,System.IFormatProvider,System.ValueTuple{System.String,System.Object}[])
member.summary: Expands the string using the supplied . Text of the form {name} will be replaced (if possible) with a string representation of the corresponding object in . If the item cannot be found then a placeholder string will be returned (but no exception will be raised). Names are matched using , meaning that names are not case sensitive.
member.param: The format provider to use when converting the interpolated objects to string. If or omitted then will be used.
A list of named objects. Each items is a (name, value) pair. If the same name is provided more than once, the latest mapping wins. Names are not case-sensitive.
member.returns: The formatted version of input string.

member.summary: Expands the string using the supplied . Text of the form {name} will be replaced (if possible) with a string representation returned by . If the item cannot be found then a placeholder string will be returned (but no exception will be raised).
member.param: The method to use to convert a {name} reference to its corresponding value.
The format provider to use when converting the objects returned by to strings. If or omitted then will be used.
member.returns: The formatted version of input string.

Formats a single issue for display to the user in (say) a modal dialog box.
Internal issues are ignored.
Only the most descriptive part of the issue message will used: message first, then title, then id, or if the issue doesn't provide any information.

member.name: T:Ansys.Disco.Core.Utilities.WpfDoEvents
member.summary: WPF version of DoEvents(), that will allow us to periodically pump windows messages during long operations.
member.remarks: Using will keep the application alive when a long operation is running on the main thread. WPF becomes unresponsive after ~5 seconds, and at this point if the user interacts with the window it will make the OS believe the application has crashed, and recommend the user closes it. Pumping windows messages gets around this, as the user and the OS will believe the application is running normally, even while all other actions are blocked.

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Utilities.WpfDoEvents.Pump
member.summary: Pumps window messages by pushing new frames with dispatcher callbacks.

member.summary: An immutable identifier that can be converted to a localized, human-readable message when passed to a message source.

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Localization.MessageServiceHelper.RegisterResourceManagers(Ansys.Disco.Core.Localization.IMessageService,System.ValueTuple{System.String,System.Resources.ResourceManager}[])
member.summary: Registers one or more instances with the current using the supplied prefixes.
member.param:
A list of 2-tuples where each tuple contains a prefix and a . If the prefix is or , the keys from the will be used as-is. If the prefix is non-empty, the will behave as though each of its resource keys was prefixed with the supplied string.
The prefix provides a way to ensure that resource keys are unique across the entire application. However, it is acceptable for more than one to share the same prefix, in which case the first that returns a resource string for a given key will win.
For example, consider two instances, both of which contain a resource key "MyMessage". By registering the first with the prefix "Foo." and the second with the prefix "Bar.", you can uniquely address the resources using "Foo.MyMessage" and "Bar.MyMessage".
member.remarks:
This method is tolerant of all failure modes:
If is , no action will be taken.
If the list is empty, no action will be taken.
If an individual source has a that is , that particular source will be ignored.

member.summary: Gets the message with the specified for the specified . This method will never throw an exception.
member.param: The message key. May safely be , in which case it will be treated as though it was .
A indicating which language should be used for the message. If , the for the current thread will be used.
member.returns: The message string if a match was found. If no match was found, the message service is free to return whatever it wants, provided that the return value is not . In this case, a sensible return value might be the key itself, or some indication that the message could not be found.

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Localization.IMessageService.Register(Ansys.Disco.Core.Localization.IMessageProvider,System.String)
member.summary: Registers an with this service. This method will never throw an exception.
member.param: The to register. No action is taken if the is . If the provider has already been registered, it is first removed using and then added as though it had never been registered.

A string that must be present at the start of the message key for this provider to be queried. The will be removed from the start of the message key before the key is presented to the provider. If is or , the provider will always be consulted (unless a previous provider has already supplied the message) and the message key will be presented to the provider unchanged.

member.name: P:Ansys.Disco.Core.Progress.IProgressMonitor.IsBackgroundOperationRunning
member.summary: This is HACK, is is necessary as the Gui operations are asking the progress monitor whether the system is busy rather than having a consistent way of determining if the system is busy. Using the progress manager ties UX around the SID to this implementation, where as UX would rather background operations are hidden from users.

member.name: T:Ansys.Disco.Core.Reporting.IReportingService
member.summary: A programmatic interface to the reporting module.
member.remarks: For the user-facing API, see Disco.ReportingModule.Reporting.CreateReportUICommand.

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Reporting.IReportingService.CreateWordReport(System.IO.FileStream@)
member.summary: Creates a report in Microsoft Word format showing the current state of the active project in Discovery. The resulting data should be written to a file as raw bytes and the file should be given a .docx extension.
member.param: The file stream, or if there was a problem.
member.returns: Returns if successful, or an if there was a problem.

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Reporting.IReportingService.CreateHtmlReport(System.IO.FileStream@)
member.summary: Creates a report in HTML format showing the current state of the active project in Discovery. The resulting data should be written to a file as raw bytes and the file should be given an .htm or .html extension.
member.param: The file stream, or if there was a problem.
member.returns: Returns if successful, or an if there was a problem.

member.summary: A user action that does nothing

member.name: T:Ansys.Disco.Core.Prediction.IUserActionPrediction
member.summary: Write-only prediction interface for user actions. Takes in any type of user action, and uses it to affect the current prediction.

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Prediction.IUserActionPrediction.AcceptAction(Ansys.Disco.Core.Prediction.IUserAction)
member.summary:
Accepts any application user action, moving the system to the new state.
If the user action doesn't apply to this instance, it is ignored.

member.name: T:Ansys.Disco.Core.Prediction.IUserActionPrediction`1
member.summary:
Prediction interface for a given type.
Predicts the probability of displaying a value of type T, given the current state of the system.
member.typeparam: Type to predict.

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Prediction.IUserActionPrediction`1.AcceptAction(Ansys.Disco.Core.Prediction.IUserAction{`0})
member.summary:
Accepts any application user action, moving the system to the new state.
If the user action doesn't apply to this instance, it is ignored.

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Prediction.IUserActionPrediction`1.ChanceToDisplay(`0)
member.summary: Determines the chance to display a specific value, given the current system knowledge
member.returns: 1.0 if the value is currently displayed. Otherwise, a [0,1] value representing the percentage chance the given value is displayed next.

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Prediction.IUserActionPrediction`1.AllChances
member.summary: Returns the global chance of moving to any value, regardless of the current state.
member.returns: Pairs of values and probabilities. Each probability is [0,1].

member.name: T:Ansys.Disco.Core.Prediction.PredictionSystem
member.summary: Assists in creating and apply user actions to IUserActionPrediction instances

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Prediction.PredictionSystem.#ctor(Ansys.Disco.Core.Context.ICurrentContext{Ansys.Disco.Core.Results.IResultDisplaySettings})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Prediction.PredictionSystem.MakePredictionSystem``1(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyCollection{System.Tuple{``0,System.Double}})
member.summary: Creates a new IUserActionPrediction instance, which updates state of type T.
member.typeparam: Type of state to predict.
member.param: Contains initial values with weights for each value.
member.returns: A new UserActionPrediction instance.

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Prediction.PredictionSystem.AcceptAction(Ansys.Disco.Core.Prediction.IUserAction)
member.summary: Accepts any action, and applies it to all instances created from this class.

member.name: T:Ansys.Disco.Core.Prediction.UserActionPrediction`1
member.summary:
Predicts the probability of displaying a value of type T, given the current state of the system.
Uses findings from "Predicting Sequences of User Actions", Brian D. Davison and Haym Hirsh.
member.typeparam: Type to predict.

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Prediction.UserActionPrediction`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyCollection{System.Tuple{`0,System.Double}})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param:
The starting state of the system. Each value will have an associated weight with it, the initial percentage is based on that weight.
Probability(x) = weight(x) / SumOfWeights().
Weights must not be less than zero.
A weight sum of 0 implies all choices are equal.

member.name: M:Ansys.Disco.Core.Prediction.UserActionPrediction`1.ChangeTo(`0)
member.summary:
Updates probabilities and changes the current (now old) row.
If we are in state A and move to state B, we need to: * Adjust the probability of being in state A and moving to B. * Change the current state to B.

member.name: T:Ansys.Disco.Core.Prediction.UserActionPrediction`1.PredictionRow`1
member.summary:
A helper class which represents a row in the prediction table.
Determines the chance of moving from the row's key to any other value. When a selection is made, updates the probabilities appropriately.
member.typeparam: Prediction template type
